\documentclass[english]{article}
\usepackage[T1]{fontenc}
\usepackage[latin9]{luainputenc}
\usepackage{geometry}
\geometry{verbose,tmargin=0.75in,bmargin=0.5in,lmargin=0.4in,rmargin=0.4in}
\usepackage{amstext}
\usepackage{amssymb}
\usepackage{babel}
\begin{document}
\title{Math 320 HW 6}
\maketitle

\section*{1)}

Let $n\mathbb{Z}=\left\{ 0,\pm n,\pm2n,\dots\right\} $ for some $n\in\mathbb{Z}$
such that $n>0$ and let $G$ be the group of integers under addition.

\subsection*{a)}

Show $n\mathbb{Z}\leq G$

\subsection*{b)}

Show $n\mathbb{Z}\approx G$ by finding an explicit isomorphism. 

\section*{2)}

Find the automorphism group of $\mathbb{Z}_{12}$. (Hint: Recall that
isomorphisms map generators to generators).

\section*{3)}

Find the inner automorphism group of $D_{4}$.

\section*{4)}

Let $G=\left(\mathbb{Q}^{+},*\right)$ be the group of positive rational
numbers under multiplication. Let $\phi:G\rightarrow G$ be given
as $\phi\left(x\right)=x^{3}$. Determine if $\phi$ is an automorphism.
If it is, prove this. If it isn't explain why not. 

\section*{5)}

Recall the center of a group $G$ is $Z\left(G\right)=\left\{ x\in G|ax=xa\ \forall a\in G\right\} $.
Let $\phi:G\rightarrow H$ be an isomorphism. Show 

\[
\phi\left(Z\left(G\right)\right)=Z\left(H\right)
\]


\section*{6)}

Let $G$ be a group. Show $\left|\text{Inn}\left(G\right)\right|=1$
if and only if $G$ is abelian. 
\end{document}
